sen.j: 磨製石器（ませいせっき）とは製作技術で分類したときの石器の種類。
sen.e: Ground stoneware is a kind of stone tool in classification by fabrication method.
Ground stone tool is a kind of stone tools in classification by fabrication method.
Ground stone tool is a kind of stone tools in classification by fabrication method.

sen.j: 通常石器は、原料となる石材を他の石材や動物骨などで敲打したり剥離したりして製作する。
sen.e: Normally stone tools were made of stone materials beaten and exfoliated by animal bones.
Normally stone tool was made of stone materials beaten and exfoliated by other stone or animal bones.
Normally stone tool was made of stone materials beaten and exfoliated by other stone or animal bones.

sen.j: 磨製石器はこのように製作した石器を他の石材で擦ることにより磨いて凹凸を極力無くした石器をさす。
sen.e: Ground stoneware was made of such stone tools which had seldom asperity by being polished with other stone material.
Ground stone tool was made of such stone tools which had seldom asperity by being polished with other stone material.
Ground stone tool was made of such stone tools which had seldom asperity by being polished with other stone material.

sen.j: 研磨作業を施さない石器を磨製石器に対し打製石器と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Stone tools which were not polished are called chipped stone tool.
Stone tools which were not polished are called chipped stone tool.

sen.j: 磨製石器には、石棒・石皿・磨石・磨製石斧・石錐などがある。
sen.e: As ground stoneware, there were stone sticks, stone plates, grating stones, stone hatchets and stone drills.
As ground stone tool, there were stone sticks, stone plates, grating stones, ground stone hatchets and stone drills, and so on.
As ground stone tool, there were stone sticks, stone plates, grating stones, ground stone hatchets and stone drills, and so on.

sen.j: 一部は旧石器時代から出現し、新石器時代（日本では縄文時代）にさかんにつくられた。
sen.e: A part of them appeared in the Paleolithic era and made often in the Neolithic era (the Jomon period in Japan).
A part of them appeared in the Paleolithic period and made often in the Neolithic period (Jomon period in Japan).

sen.j: 研磨の技法には、擦切技法などがある。
sen.e: As a technique of polishing, there was scrapping technique.
As a technique of polishing, there was scrapping technique, and so on.

sen.j: また、刃部だけを磨いた局部磨製石器と呼ばれるものも存在する。
sen.e: Also there was local ground stoneware which only the cutting parts were polished.
Also there was local ground stone tool which only the cutting parts were polished.

sen.j: これは、おもに石斧に用いられた。
sen.e: Those were used mainly for stone hatchets.

sen.j: 弥生時代の北部九州では、朝鮮半島起源の磨製石鏃と磨製石剣が発達した。
sen.e: In Yayoi period, in northern part of Kyushu, flint arrowhead and stone sword of ground stoneware which came from the Korean Peninsula were developed.
In Yayoi period, in northern part of Kyushu, flint arrowhead and stone sword of ground stone tools which originated in the Korean Peninsula were developed.

sen.j: 磨製石剣には柄の部分まで石でつくった有柄式磨製石剣と鉄剣形磨製石剣がある。
sen.e: As stone swords of ground stoneware there were stone handle type and iron sword type.
There were two types of the stone swords of ground stone tool such as ones with stone handle and ones in iron sword style.

sen.j: 北九州の鉄剣形磨製石剣を真似た畿内式打製尖頭器は、槍・剣・戈として使われた。
sen.e: Kinai style chipped point which imitated the Iron sword type was used as spear, sword and pike.
Kinai style chipped points which imitated the stone sword of the ground stone tools in iron sword style was used as spear, sword and pike.

sen.j: 南関東では、打製・磨製を問わず石鏃や石剣はほとんどない。
sen.e: In Southern Kanto region there were very few flint arrowheads and stone swords of both chipped stone tool and ground stoneware.
